Reviews.Title: Beautiful Phone. Android for a blackberry addict.
Reviews.Author: Dimitri
Reviews.Content: Before this phone I went through then NokiaE71, then moved to blackberries. I absolutely love the form factor and I really wanted a keyboard. I also wanted to try android because I didn't want to pay for BIS anymore.Buying this phone I wanted it to do two things: Check email and live long on battery. It excels at both, and does much much more.Start with the cons:* Camera is abysmal, but pretty much on par with my old blackberry.* Very low system space. This can be fixed a little, even without root, through using ADB to allow you to move bloatware to the SD card.* A little slow with large games: I can play world of goo and temple run but some of the larger games will lag.* The phone is not designed to be used in portrait mode much, but several apps only work in portrait, which means you have to hold your phone sideways.* Tiny market for this phone so rooting it is not as easy as some other phones, and there are no custom roms out for it.* Stock android phone app could be better, and no dialing from home screen.* No central place for all incoming messages to go, sms and chat and email are all separate. This is a con of android v blackberry and not a fault of this phone.* Alarms do not show up in agenda view. Again this is a fault of android, not the phone.The Pros:* Keyboard is great. Seemed odd at first, but broke in and became perfect.* Touchscreen is small, but good! I have had no complaints about latency and what not.* Looks and feels exactly like my blackberry did, people thought I never switched phones.* Revives email very well, great for composing emails.* Have taken phone to the beach several times and had no issues.* Battery lasts forever -- several days -- and the screen is not always the main consumer of battery!* Taken this phone out of the country to Europe and it worked like a charm.* Ridiculously loud speakers, never missed an alarm with it.This may not seem like a 4 star review, given all the cons, but it's the overall experience that I am rating. This phone does exactly what I wanted it to do, it replaces my blackberry. It may not be a flagship android beast, but it works, and it works well and reliably. My next phone probably will not have a keyboard, but I am glad this phone does. I would buy this phone again if it broke.

Reviews.Title: This ones's pretty good
Reviews.Author: H. C. Redondo "Chirriche"
Reviews.Content: This phone has all I need. Especially the qwerty keyboard.It's amazing to write on it. At first you feel it kind of slow, but after a week you get used to it, and becomes softer the more you use it.The screen size is something I don't care too much about, but I'm pleased that the GB 2.3 works perfectly well with all apps on Play. Like the most important ones I mean.The five stars is for the call buttons that makes the device, a CELLPHONE... not that big size screens with no buttons I don't really get used to.The waterproof is good, but is not going to surf with your phone on the pocket... besides why would you surf with your cellphone.. I mean is surf.. but it works for like going on a walk and get wet and then clean it and then... you know, adventure.The other good thing is the D-Pad that if you like to write like a professional, then it's a must because when you mistake, your thumbs are so big that it will press all the word instead of the letter you want to erase.One thing I don't like is that there are some preinstalled apps that updates whenever you got into Internet connection and this I hate, because the device's memory is kind of small, so those updates steal some memory that could be free. For example Facebook or Google+. Dude.... you can't uninstall neither of them. NEITHER!The last CON I have realized is the camera quality... I mean in dark places forget about it because it's pretty bad. In sunny days you can get good pictures and stuff but don't expect it to be like S4 or Iphone. Then I realized that with this app for the camera (Camera Zoom FX) you can get really good pictures and with a lot more settings like ISO and stuff.But overall, it's a pretty good phone for that people that can't quit the buttons-phones and love something little and kind of cheap.I wrote this on my XT560 (:**excuse my english, I'm from Latam* Other bad thing is this USSD code for prepaid lines of my country. I can't see how much is left in my account, I just have to call the service. But.... Bla

Reviews.Title: Meeting Expectations
Reviews.Author: Lago "Lagoboss"
Reviews.Content: 7/4/2013I would definitely recommend this product to a friend.Construction/Design:This phone is listed as waterproof, however upon further investigation on the Motorola website, the phone is really water resistant.  I bought this phone so that my fragile i717 could miss out on abuse this summer during summer camp.Additionally, the phone is marketed as being sturdy, however there is a dent in the upper left metallic covering around the bezel just from being in my pocket with keys for a short period of time.On two occasions in the last week, I have found that the battery door has unlocked itself and detached from the phone; not good for water resistance.The 3.5mm headphone jack's rubber cover takes a great deal of force to open for the head phone jack.The d pad feels flimsy.Based on the written description here and on the Motorola site, the phone, in my opinion, deserves 3/5 stars.Camera:The camera produces dark and grainy pictures in a low light or indoors setting.I give it 3/5 stars.Features:The phone has a ton of features that are cool.It is water resistant which is a plus, however I do not want to test this feature.The built in compass seems like it could be helpful while exploring an unknown area.The vanilla Wifi hotspot feature is like a dream come true.  Most unlocked phones are still bound by At&t;'s tethering rules, however this phone is stripped of that and is able to create a wifi hotsopt out of the box.The FM radio is always a good thing to have for emergencies or if there is no songs on the phone.It has a built in flash flight application that utilizes the built in flash from the camera.It gets 5/5 stars in this department.Signal:I use Pure GSM which uses At&t; cell towers and the phone was able to maintain 4g/3g when my friend's iPhone 4 only got 2g or lost the signal.  It has not gone below 3G or 3 bars in the same places that my i717 loses signals all of the time.It gets 5/5Battery:This phone really shines in power management.  It can last two full days on a single charge with my usage pattern.  As a disclaimer, I work 7 hours of which I do not use the phone that much unless it is being used as a hotspot momentarily to load media onto another device.  I also play music to and from work.  If your usage pattern is similar, I would expect great battery.  However, on my i717 my battery only lasts 12 hours before it needs to be charged and that is with normal use.It gets 5/5 stars in this category.Performance:The phone is snappy on most tasks, however sluggish on some.  If you are not going to play dead space or tap tap 4, I think that it would be good for your needs.It gets 4/5 stars here.OS:The phone is running Motorola blur interface I think; it may not be so check up on that.  I cannot really tell that it is there if it is.  There is a useful Motorola widget that tracks the apps that one uses the most and keeps them in a central location for easy access.  It is not as terrible as the Motorola Charm that I use to have.There is hardly any trace that this is a phone from Rogers, the Canadian Carrier.It gets 5/5 stars here.I will update as needed.I give it 4.5 Stars out of 5 at the moment.

Reviews.Title: great phone
Reviews.Author: Amy Rose
Reviews.Content: This is a great phone for those of us who still prefer having actual keys instead of just touchscreens. This phone doesn't have the speed of the new "superphones" out there, but it is a very reliable phone. The phone is very comfortable to hold, the keys soft and easy to use. The battery in this phone is amazing - after using so many large touchscreen phones, I forgot how long a battery could last. The signal strength/service is much better on this phone then the newer "superphones" as well.If your looking for a quality "phone" without some of the unnecessary extras, then this would be a great buy.

Reviews.Title: I gifted this phone and recipient liked this phone
Reviews.Author: K. Acharya
Reviews.Content: I gifted this phone and recipient liked this phone.  He said he always liked BlackBerry and wanted to get one but didn't necessarily liked only keyboards, he wanted to have responsive screen also.  This was kind of a good solution for him and for me a nice and easy decision for a gift :)

Reviews.Title: not splash resistant
Reviews.Author: Paul V
Reviews.Content: after 1 month , my cellphone has dust under glass screen and after rain  screen also showed condensation and  water signs.... used vacuum cleaner to remove condensate  from under the screen.You can't return this phone after 30 daysi'm using in the same time Cat B15 and samsung gt b2710 and none of them ever have any  problems with moisture and dust

Reviews.Title: Fast, ergonomic, AND it's a phone in FIRST
Reviews.Author: MartinC
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone to replace a so-called "smatphone" (Samsung Galaxy Ace 2).  It's day and night:  the battery last for days (even with bluethoot and WiFi enabled), the OS reacts instantly to tactile-screen commands, and the major point: the keyboard.  No more soft keyboard for me.  I now can phone right away without going from menu to menu, just like the old flip phone.The sound quality is excellent, the pre-installed apps are very limited, just the useful ones (calendar, mailbox, contacts, web browser, google play, music player, gps navigator).With a Google account, your contacts synchs, no KIES-like software needed.Hope this help!

Reviews.Title: china uniom 3G  Not supported
Reviews.Author: mousefish2099
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately  it not support 2100MHZ，i put my SIM card of  china unicom in cellphone, can only use EDGE mode to connect Internet,not 3G OR hsdpa mode.

Reviews.Title: my phone is not a good one
Reviews.Author: gengxiaolan
Reviews.Content: first , the mobile is locked , i pay for 4 GBP to unlock. i can't use it in china  ;second , the screen is alittle wrong , i am good at english , but the phone' screen is not good . XT560 is a good phone ,my this one is not good . the screen is not good .

Reviews.Title: Motorola has another good overlooked phone
Reviews.Author: John F. Ockert
Reviews.Content: Good phone. I am using this with straighttalk. Data rates are slower than the Motorola pro + but this phone has the "tough" advantages. I find it hard to press some on screen buttons that are located on the upper right hand corner. Solid keyboard and app selection.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: CRWick
Reviews.Content: Great phone. I love that it has a keyboard without having to flip open or slide anything. And that it gives you both keyboard and touchscreen. And I was happy that it is a Motorola. I am giving it four stars and not five because there are no cases for it and it does freeze up sometimes.

Reviews.Title: Really love :) this phone!!
Reviews.Author: YunGirl
Reviews.Content: After researching and finding which phone has all my wants of a phone that is basic, rugged, quality cheap, versatile, and functional, plus have to look cute, I picked this phone. I felt instantly in loved with this phone once I received this in the mail and activated it. Although unfortunately a week and a half later that I have this phone I  accidentally dropped it straight face onto the pavement which crack the screen; however, it was still functioning like normal. I believed it would have survived being cracked if it had fell on the rugged rims of the phone. I had the phone replaced by the same seller, because even though it was slightly a little bit more expensive it came very fast considering I needed another phone as quickly as possible, When it came in a few days I became happier again :D. About the pros and cons of this phone, I would agree with most of it, leaning more on the pros than cons.

Reviews.Title: Didn't Work for Me!
Reviews.Author: C. Lloyd
Reviews.Content: IWhen I received this phone and put it together it looked like it might be a nice phone.  But when I read the "instruction manual" it was utterly useless, nothing much in it.  So I got online to look up the instruction manual and realized that I may not have the genuine product as there were things in the manual that my phone didn't have.  I decided to give it a few days to see how it worked.  Unfortunately I was not able to use it much as I couldn't get reception on it most of the time.  I never had a problem with my old, much cheaper, phone but I was never able to get more than one weak bar on this phone the whole week I had it.  So this obviously wouldn't work for me.  Returned for a refund - Amazon Customer Service was wonderful as always!

Reviews.Title: Nice phone!  Similar to blackberry!
Reviews.Author: patricia mcleod
Reviews.Content: I liked the phone, but it did network with my tmobile old sim nor pulled up the calendar for me which was a bummer.  This is truly a nice phone though and has a built in flashlight that is bright!  The back has a lock method which was cool because the feature is solid.  Great apps.  So I'm bummed but  :(. I would DEFINITELY recommend this phone despit my issues!

Reviews.Title: Looks are deceiving
Reviews.Author: Fariz Aliev
Reviews.Content: Looks are deceiving, just because it looks like a blackberry does not mean its one. Overall fact that its an Android phonewas the reason for my purchase. Unfortunately Key_Board and overall product quality is very low. Keys are made withrubber type of material making qwerty board useless. Not a product I would recoment having, does not substitute BB.

Reviews.Title: Motorola Defy Pro XT560
Reviews.Author: James H. Dunn III
Reviews.Content: An under the radar smart phone with qwerty keypad; offers advantages of both touch screen and tactilecertainty for texting and dialing. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: Water proof? not for the screen!
Reviews.Author: herphase
Reviews.Content: The andrew system, key board, and battery are the 5/5 partsBut, do not believe in the so called "water proof" feature. I thought IP67 guarantees that it could be cleaned at the meantime of washing hands, but absolutely I was wrong. It happened several times that the touch screen stopped work when there was water on it, and I didn't care and thought "oh, that is interesting", until the last week I finally understood it was because the water leaked into the screen!!! Water appeared inside the screen, sometimes made no response to touching, and sometimes got softwares go crazy. The only thing I could do was to leave the screen locked, and waited for 5 days. It is extremely bad experience, and I would rate lower than 0/5 to its water proof.I am not the only one suffered from water leaking in the screen, and I believe the only solution is that Motorola re-designs their water sealing for the screen. Never ever rely on this feature

Reviews.Title: Excellent phone.
Reviews.Author: Pedro Gil A
Reviews.Content: After living a bad experience buying the "Motrola PRO + MB632" which did no good because the screen stopped working a few hours to turn it on, I decided to continue to rely on Motorola and buy this phone, do not regret at all of my decision, the Android Gingerbread operating system even though the phone only has 512 MB ​​of RAM is very fast and fluid, and brought a feature that impressed me was able to make VPN connections through the preinstalled software.The phone worked perfectly, just inserted my SIM card and I started using it, carefully, 3G only works in the 850 Mhz and 1900 Mhz.

Reviews.Title: Motorola Defy Pro
Reviews.Author: frobinson
Reviews.Content: I like it, it does what I need it to do. Some features I am not too crazy about. For example, I wish I could touch any key to light up the display screen. That is just a preference. I am still learning other features of this phone. So far, I like it.

Reviews.Title: So Far So Good
Reviews.Author: ricco123
Reviews.Content: the delvery was very quick Ordered it On Friday and arrived Monday Morning, Im surprised this Phone isn't sold in the US or picked up by a US Carrier. Wel the things I was looking for this phone has it, physical QWERTY keypad, Touchscreen and Android. Also a decent Front faced Camera, and able to add android Apps fairly easily. I still get to maintain all the best of modern smartphone capabilities. Its unlocked as well, GSM flowed perfectly... My only gripe about this Phone that it looks too much like a Blackberry LOL and lacks no options for Faceplates/Hardcovers which im constanly trying to find online. Overal I get it a 8.5 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: Not bad!
Reviews.Author: deuce
Reviews.Content: I have this phone on AT&T; 3g.Waterproof!!! Or resistant?I held this phone under a faucet and turned on the water, then wiped off the phone and it still works perfectly :)Front & Rear Cameras!You need to make some adjustments in the camera settings or else your photos will be really dark and not look good.I'm constantly on this phone internet, texting, email, and the battery lasts all day.Not a lot of internal memory, but comes with 2GB sd card for more.Qwerty keyboard and touch screen is the main reason i bought this phone, it's a good little phone and i'm sure it will last longer than i want.

Reviews.Title: Well made product
Reviews.Author: Perez
Reviews.Content: This phone is well put together. It has very good talk time hours. I work as a field mechanic tech. So this phone meets my every need. I like QWERTY keypads and since it runs on android i was able to pull all my contact from google. Saved me a lot of headache. I will recommend this phone to any.

Reviews.Title: Best phone for this price range.
Reviews.Author: Marcelo, BR "Marcelo Teixeira"
Reviews.Content: First of all its not an all plastic phone.Looks strong and it is, Motorola describes the Defy Pro as life-proof.The processor is fast enough. It's not for gamers of course.A real physical keyboard is a plus for dudes with big hands like me.Front facing camera is an interesting feature for video calls.The downside is the android version, they should launch an upgrade ASAP.

Reviews.Title: True water proof
Reviews.Author: khalid mazhar mehdi
Reviews.Content: One of the best phones with great user interface , strong signal and clear sounds and great connectivity optionsRecomended buy

Reviews.Title: great phone
Reviews.Author: Rice
Reviews.Content: The greatest phone I have owned: great keyboard, battery lasts two days, system works perfect....satisfying all my needs. The only con is that the USB in the left side makes me feel a little uncomfortable, but maybe it has to be designed in that way for waterproof.

Reviews.Title: Best rugged phone on the market and 1/2 the price ! LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: I needed a phone that was rugged but didnt look like a brick. This has all the features like my blackberry .I get all my emails and now i have android for all the new apps.awesome on at&t; with 3g speed . Love it!

Reviews.Title: ITS LOCKED!!!
Reviews.Author: Patrick
Reviews.Content: IT IS A LOCK CELL PHONE!!!!! NEVER BUY IT!!!I NEED TO TYPE IN THE SIM NETWORK UNLOCK PIN!!!NEVER NEVER BUY IT

ProductInfo.Features:
Cellular Band - Quad-Band 850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900 Mhz
Cellular Band 3G - 850 / 1900 Mhz
ProductInfo.Name: Motorola Defy Pro XT560 Black WiFi Android Touchscreen Unlocked 3G Cell Phone
